It is the specialty of Indian cuisine and Delicacy, as I havenâ€™t shared Vegetable Dum Biryani I will soon share the amazing recipe in my food blog, stay tuned ðŸŒ¸ Letâ€™s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure [caption id="attachment_9962" align="alignnone" width="4096"] Full snap[/caption] Ingredients:
  • Bay leaves - Â 5
  • Cloves - 10
  • Cinnamon pieces - 2
  • Nutmeg - 1/2
  • Black Cardamom - 4
  • Green Cardamom - 8
  • Kapok Buds / Marathi moggu - 1
  • Star anise - 2
  • Stone flower - 5 gms
  • Mace / javitri - 2
  • Coriander seeds - 1/4 cup
  • Black cumin seeds / shajeera - 1 Tb sp
  • Kashmiri Dry Red chillies - 3
[caption id="attachment_9964" align="alignnone" width="2457"] Mini glass jar with flip lid bought from IKEA - I stored biryani Masala Powder In it[/caption] Procedure:
  • On medium heated pan add coriander seeds, black Cumin seeds, Bay leaves and red chillies
  • Dry roast them for a minute or so and then add rest of the ingredients in pan
  • Fry them till the color changes and you can smell the Â fresh spices aroma filled in kitchen ðŸ˜Š
  • Turn off heat and transfer them to a plate and let them cool down
  • Grind them to smooth powder in mixer grinder
  • Store in an airtight container to remain fresh , you can preserve upto 6 months
